title: A Ghost Galaxy with No Stars
summary: Astronomers using the Hubble Space Telescope found a special cloud in space called Cloud-9. It is made of gas and dark matter, which is a mysterious material that we cannot see because it does not give off light. Cloud-9 has no stars at all, which makes it very unusual. Scientists think it is like a failed galaxy that never grew stars. This discovery helps us learn about the early Universe and how galaxies form. Cloud-9 is small and round, and it is located near our Milky Way galaxy. By studying it, astronomers can understand more about dark matter and hidden parts of space.

options: It does not give off light

options: Dark matter and the early Universe
questions.correct_answer: Dark matter and the early Universe

background_read: Space is full of many things like stars, planets, and clouds of gas. Astronomers use telescopes to look at these objects and learn about the Universe. Dark matter is a special kind of material that we cannot see directly, but it is very important because it helps hold galaxies together. Cloud-9 is a new discovery that shows a cloud with dark matter but no stars, which is like a piece of the early Universe that never grew up into a full galaxy. This helps scientists understand how galaxies form and what the Universe was like long ago.
Article_Structure: WHO: Astronomers using the Hubble Space Telescope
WHAT: Found a cloud called Cloud-9 with gas and dark matter but no stars
WHERE: Near the Milky Way galaxy in space
WHY: To learn about dark matter and how galaxies form

perspectives.description: Finding Cloud-9 helps astronomers study dark matter and the early Universe.
